note.p: Corrected proof of "My 71st Year," which appeared in the November 1889 issue of The Century Illustrated Monthly Magazine.

lg.head: MY 71st YEAR.
lg.l: With all their chances, changes, losses, sorrows,

My parents' deaths, the vagaries of my life, the many tearing
passions of me, ‸the war of '63 and '4

As some old broken soldier, after a long, hot, wearying march,
or haply after battle,

At twilight, hobbling, answering yet to company roll-call‸,/ Here‸,/
with vital voice,
Reporting yet, saluting yet the Officer over all.
